result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles A. Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:59 PM Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, 22CF147, and 22CM36 called together.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell in court, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Charles A. Mitchell.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case 22CF147 is on for preliminary hearing.  Atty Lawton updates- defendant wants to waive the preliminary hearing.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Cover letter to proposed Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Cases 22CF20, 22CF43, 2022CF000147, and 2022CM000036 called together. Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton appeared in person for Charles A. Mitchell.  Def appears by video from Bayfield County jail.  Case 22CF147 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. WTLPH.  Court addresses a bond motion, will hear argument.  Atty Lawton argues in support of his bond motion to allow def to attend programming.  ADA Schmidt responds, opposed to bond modification.  Court denies bond motion at this time.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

11:35 AM Cases 22CF20, 2022CF000043, 2022CF000147, and 2022CM000036 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Charles A. Mitchell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Samuel Louis Lawton in court for Charles A. Mitchell.  Atty Lawton updates- not appointed in the new file (on for initial appearance).  Court appoints Atty Lawton in 21CF147.  Adjourned initial appearance to be set in that matter.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant must post $50,000 additional cash bond to be released from custody (for a total of $55,250 to cover Burnett County cases 22GF160, 22CM36, 22CF43, and 22CF20).  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
